unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Don't Get Caught in a Landlord-Tenant Drama Like in "House Owner"!**
normalised: **Rental Agreements: Do Not Get Caught in a Landlord-Tenant Drama Like in "House Owner"!**

unnormalised: So, we've all heard stories of rental nightmares, right? Remember the Malayalam movie "House Owner" – pretty much sums up how things can go south if your rental agreement isn't solid.
normalised: So, we have all heard stories of rental nightmares, right? Remember the Malayalam movie "House Owner" – pretty much sums up how things can go south if your rental agreement is not solid.

unnormalised: Seriously, whether you're renting a swanky flat in Bandra or a cozy 1BHK near your college in Delhi, a well-drafted rental agreement is your best friend. It's not just a formality; it's your legal shield!
normalised: Seriously, whether you are renting a swanky flat in Bandra or a cozy one B H K near your college in Delhi, a well-drafted rental agreement is your best friend. It is not just a formality; it is your legal shield!

unnormalised: Think of it as your "janam patri" for your stay. It clearly defines the terms: rent (Rs. 15,000, 20,000, whatever!), deposit amount, due date for rent (say, the 5th of every month), maintenance charges, lock-in period (maybe 11 months, renewable on 01/01/2025) and even little things like who’s responsible for minor repairs.
normalised: Think of it as your "janam patri" for your stay. It clearly defines the terms: rent (rupees fifteen thousand, twenty thousand, whatever!), deposit amount, due date for rent (say, the fifth of every month), maintenance charges, lock-in period (maybe eleven months, renewable on first january two thousand and twenty five) and even little things like who is responsible for minor repairs.

unnormalised: Make sure it explicitly mentions rules about pets, overnight guests (Aunty Shobha coming to stay for Diwali!), and any restrictions on renovations (no, you can't paint the walls Bollywood red without permission!).
normalised: Make sure it explicitly mentions rules about pets, overnight guests (Aunty Shobha coming to stay for Diwali!), and any restrictions on renovations (no, you can not paint the walls Bollywood red without permission!).

unnormalised: Important tip for us Indians: get it notarized! It just adds that extra layer of authenticity, especially if things get heated. Plus, include clauses related to notice period (usually 30 days, sometimes 2 months) and procedures for early termination.
normalised: Important tip for us Indians: get it notarized! It just adds that extra layer of authenticity, especially if things get heated. Plus, include clauses related to notice period (usually thirty days, sometimes two months) and procedures for early termination.

unnormalised: Also, do a proper inspection of the property *before* signing and document any pre-existing damage (dated 10/10/2024, say 09:30 hrs), preferably with photos and signed by both parties. Avoids headaches later.
normalised: Also, do a proper inspection of the property *before* signing and document any pre-existing damage (dated tenth october two thousand and twenty four, say nine thirty hours), preferably with photos and signed by both parties. Avoids headaches later.

unnormalised: Finally, remember to consult a lawyer if you're unsure about any clauses. It's a small investment that can save you a lot of trouble down the line. Happy renting, folks!
normalised: Finally, remember to consult a lawyer if you are unsure about any clauses. It is a small investment that can save you a lot of trouble down the line. Happy renting, folks!
